text: Activation and expression of the nuclear factors of activated T cells , <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> NFATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , in human natural killer cells : regulation upon CD16 ligand binding .

text: The putative factors that couple the signal transduction from surface receptors to the activation of cytokine synthesis in natural killer ( NK ) cells have not been elucidated .

We report here that the nuclear factor of activated T cells ( <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , a cyclosporin A ( CsA ) - sensitive factor that regulates the transcription of several cytokines , mediates CD16 - induced activation of cytokine genes in human NK cells .
CD16 ( <extra_id_0> Fc gamma RIIIA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) - induced expression of cytokine mRNA in NK cells occurs via a CsA - sensitive and Ca ( 2+ ) - dependent mechanism .
Stimulation of NK cells with CD16 ligands induces NFAT-like DNA binding activity in the nuclear extracts from these cells , as detected in electrophoretic mobility shift assays .
This occurs with fast kinetics after stimulation , via a CsA - sensitive and Ca ( 2+ ) - dependent mechanism that does not require de novo protein synthesis .
NK cell NFAT is present in the cytosol of nonstimulated cells , migrates to the nucleus upon stimulation , and can associate with AP-1 .
Two distinct molecules , <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> NFATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , have been reported to mediate NFAT activity .

The results of supershift assays using <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and <extra_id_0> NFATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific antibodies indicate that NK cell activation early after CD16 ligand binding involves primarily , if not exclusively , <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and Western blot analysis shows that this has the same electrophoretic mobility ( approximately 120 kD ) as that of T lymphocytes .

NK cells do not express <extra_id_0> NFATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> constitutively , but <extra_id_0> NFATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA accumulation is induced in these cells within 2 h of stimulation with CD16 ligands .

text: However , supershift assays using the available mAb recognizing the T cell <extra_id_0> NFATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> revealed no detectable <extra_id_0> NFATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein in nuclear and cytoplasmic extracts from CD16 - or phorbol ester - stimulated cells at any time tested , up to 4 h .

These results provide the first direct evidence that both CsA - sensitive transcription factors , <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> NFATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , are expressed in human NK cells , and that their activation and / or expression can be regulated in primary cells by a single stimulus , that , in the case of CD16 in NK cells , results in early activation of <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and subsequently induced expression of <extra_id_0> NFATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA .
